contexts.context: ...<excludes> <!-- We only index files which have <mark>illustrations</mark> in them. -->  <exclude type="index"   xpath="html[not(descendant::meta[@name='Has illustration(s)'][@content='true'])]"/> <!--...

...which have illustrations in them. -->  <exclude type="index"   xpath="html[not(descendant::meta[@name='Has <mark>illustration</mark>(s)'][@content='true'])]"/> <!-- We ignore the document type filter,...
...these documents because it's pointless. -->  <exclude type="filter"   xpath="meta[@name='Has <mark>illustration</mark>(s)']"/> </excludes>
...all documents which do not contain <meta name="Has <mark>illustration</mark>(s)" content="true"/>> should be ignored. Then we use...
...page), and second, that the boolean filter Has <mark>illustrations</mark>(s) should also be excluded.
...if some of your documents are specified as '<mark>Illustrated</mark>' and some not (true or false), a...
...a JSON file will be created for the '<mark>Illustrated</mark>' facet, with a list of documents which...
...might for instance specify that some poems are <mark>illustrated</mark> while others are not. The user could...
...user could then limit their search only to <mark>illustrated</mark> poems.
